reviews.text: I stayed in a family suite which was very spacious and well equiped. The hotel was modern and spotlessly clean. While there, we used the pool which was great for the kids and had dinner in the restaurant on two nights. The food was really good and the service was excellent throughout the hotel for the entire weekend.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - excellent service

reviews.text: Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and the managers who were very attentive and efficient on a busy weekend.
reviews.title: Best hotel yet that we've been to for our annual family reunion !

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this Hotel to anybody looking for a relaxing break. It is at the high end of a four star facility.
reviews.title: 3rd time lucky

reviews.text: The facilities in this hotel were so suitable for a group of people with 19 very young children. The bedrooms were so spacious and clean that all families big and small were so very comfortable. The leisure centre was perfect and also very clean. The food and the waiter service were excellent and the courteous staff were a pleasure to deal with. Would love to go back there sooner rather than later.
reviews.title: Just about ok...nothing to write home about

reviews.text: stayed here for 1 night with my sister. i had a voucher which i received from a previous visit as at that time i had a few issues. this was my 3rd visit,and i must say it was the best. the hotel was very quite and relaxed,where before i visited at 2 very busy times.this really is a lovely modern hotel. we stayed in a suite and it was perfect,fab bathroom and powerful shower. we ate in bar,as previously food is a little pricey,however it is of a superior standard to your average bar food. I am glad i gave it another visit and will definitley be going back in the new year.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel - Top class staff and Manager

reviews.text: Just returned from a two night stay in the Shearwater Ballinasloe. Staff were very helpful and friendly . We had stayed in this hotel before,shortly after it was opened and were extremely impressed then, however we were disappointed this time to see how the hotel has deteriorated in 4 years.
reviews.title: Falling Standards

reviews.text: The window in our room looked like it had not been cleaned in 4 years, the window did not close allowing the traffic noise to disrupt sleep. The bathroom basin was so badly cracked it was amazing it still held water, the toilet roll holder was hanging off the wall.
reviews.title: Retired Nurses A.G.M.

reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was less than 4 star, everything just tasted of saturated grease it had been sitting so long.
reviews.title: Great Hotel For Business and Leisure - Well Located for Day Trips round Ireland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The leisure centre is still a jewel in the crown of this hotel, staff again were very helpful and the facility is immaculate, more like a 5 star.
reviews.title: back again to stay at the sheerwater

reviews.text: Our stay in The Carlton Shearwater Hotel for two nights was a very pleasant experience. The hotel was very comfortable and the staff most pleasant and helpful, from the Receptionist, who greeted us with a smile, the Manager who was so pleasant at all times, and all the staff in general, who had been through a very stressful week previously. The loss of their Head Chef was a terrible blow to them, but thet pulled out all the stops to make our stay a very pleasant one.
reviews.title: Fab hotel, pity about dinner :(

reviews.text: Lovely hotel! Room was nice and clean, staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was great - had a massive selection, we got bar food and it was gorgeous but small portions :( We had a nice bit of eye candy too with some Italian rugby team staying there... wonder is that permanent thing - I'd be back quicker haha! But I would definitely stay there again and recommend to friends - we got a great deal through Lidl Breaks for 39euro B&B :)
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back after weekend stay. Good Hotel, easy to locate. Good parking, free, underground and safe.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Excellent Staff

reviews.text: Excellent welcome, booked a suite, well worth the few euro extra. Staff, in all areas of the hotel were professional, excellent and customer friendly, nothing was too much bother. Food and drinks, both bar and restaurant was excellent and reasonable. Fabulous gym and pool.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel for A Family Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Faults - very little. Foyer and surrounding areas dark and cold, also bathroom in room was quite dark. No bright light for applying makeup - ( my wifes, not mine ).
reviews.title: beautiful modern,clean and spacious hotel!!!!

reviews.text: No worries staying in this hotel.- Enjoy
reviews.title: Spotless and great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a wedding recently and was not impressed. On check-in, we went to our room to find the bed unmade and wet towels on the floor and table. Rang down to reception to tell them and they made only a cursory apology and told us to come down again to reception to get a new room, which was annoying-they should have met us at a new room rather than us trekking all around the hotel with our suitcases.Then they didnt even allow us to skip the long queue of wedding guests waiting to check-in. The service from the girl on the desk was unfriendly and harried-they should have had more people on at such a busy time so it wasn't fully her fault. Then in the new room there were no toiletries so we had to embark on a mission to get them.Other little niggles were the nice cosy bar being locked for the duration of the wedding with the only option for a quiet drink being in the big, brightly lit sports-bar with big screens blaring.Also, at breakfast, when I pointed out to the waiter that we would probably need another pot of tea-there was one smallish pot between three- he replied in a really argumentative voice that the pot held enough for three. Sure enough, when we wanted more tea, there were no staff to be seen so we had to get up and find a waiter who seemingly promised to get some but walked around for ages doing nothing and never brought the tea..None of these things are a big deal on their own but all add up to a below par experience for the price. I would not recommend.
reviews.title: Not great

reviews.text: We stayed here last week for 5 nights and great time. Hotel is very large and was extremely bust when we were there however was very enjoyable and great for the kids. The swimming pool was brilliant which they loved and they also did a kids club 2 nights whereby they did supervised swimming, arts & crafts, dinner time and then DVD. This really made the trip for my kids. The food was really good in the bar and very reasonably priced. The only downside was the heat in the bedrooms, although there was air con it wasnt great and didnt make that much of a difference, and to open the window you could then hear all the noise from the function rooms. However working in hotels I know that this is part & parcel of hotel life during the summer months, it wouldn't put me off returning. Its also a great base location for Athlone and Galway as theres not much in Ballinasloe itself. But great hotel, lovely staff and well worth a visit.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: Hotel was very nice, rooms nice and comfortable, breakfast was ok - fruit salad was very poor, bar nice atmosphere....There is same menu for bar and restaurant, when we asked for a la carte they didnt have any, but have to say that food was absolutely delicious!!!!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, but nut nithing to do Ballinasloe

reviews.text: There is not much to to in Ballinasloe but not far from Athlone or Galway.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.text: Our stay at the Carlton Shearwater was everything we could have hoped for-a large, clean, quiet room with a large, clean bathroom, a great spa with a large swimming pool and jacuzzi. The weight room was large as well with a good number of treadmills. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Just a 20 minute drive east of Galway or an hour and a half from Dublin, this hotel is a great choice.
reviews.title: Expensive for what you get
